Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyUniontown
Reviews.Content: While staying at the Admiral Motel in Ocean City was definently a nightmare. The room was very dingy and dirty, no door handle on the bathroom door, the bathroom window did not close all the way, the bathroom sink leaked all over the floor and the commode only flushed every hour also ants all in the room. Will never recommend this hotel to anyone!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Berkeley Springs, West Virginia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want a disease!”
Reviews.Author: BacheloretteWknd
Reviews.Content: This motel was horrible! We walked into room and as soon as we walked in we were sick to our stomachs! It was filthy, holes all through the walls, urine on the sink, and ants everywhere!!!!! The refrigerator was corroded to the floor also. We went to the front desk and told them why we weren't staying and the boy looked at the other guy and asked if they had anymore ant spray and the guy responded "we used it all on the other rooms." I seen there receipt book on desk and they had three other rooms additional to mine where they wrote "ANTS." So they know they are infested but still book their disgusting rooms! We asked for our money back and they said they wouldn't give us that night back even though we had only been there for 15 mins. So needless to say if you want a disease or to be eaten alive by ants then stay here...if not then don't! We didn't! I don't know how they can't be shut down with all the filth, urine and ants everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Where do I begin?”
Reviews.Author: xBre2007x
Reviews.Content: Oh dear God, where do I start? My fiance and I stayed in a very nice hotel for the entire week before coming here. We wanted an extra night on the weekend in order to go out. Every where was either booked or so so expensive (and after paying a lot to stay the week, we didn't want to spend much more) but I would have payed another hundred dollars on top of the 130 we already paid instead of staying here. We are younger (20's) and I didn't think I would mind that much staying in a less nice place. I honestly felt scared for my life after seeing some of the people staying in this hotel. I always triple checked our hotel room door to make sure it was locked. Now on to the room... The second I walked in I began laughing hysterically because I didn't imagine the room could possibly be thatt bad. The ceiling was splattered all over with what looked like dried blood. Our TV I think was from 1980 and glowed bright green on every TV station. Our A/C unit did work, but it also looked like it was from 1980. The bed, to my surprise, was clean and there were no stains on the sheets. The bathroom blind was broken and pieces were jagging out randomly and it wouldn't go up or down. Being a small girl, I probably would have barely fit into the stand up shower. It was a very small square built into the wall. Thankfully we had already showered that day at our other hotel, so we never had to use it. The toilet was almost on the ground so to sit down on it I felt like I was falling over. The carpet was stained here and there and I never unpacked anything and kept our bags on the dresser. The room above us was awake and screaming/pounding on the floors and walls until at least 3:30am. We were thankfully out and up that late but I would have been infuriated had I wanted to go to bed sooner. It was definitely an experience which I will never be repeating again. Thank got it was only one night. Please just spend the extra money and go else where. We should have.

Reviews.Title: “Collapsed ceiling used feminine pads”
Reviews.Author: armyjodonn
Reviews.Content: The ceiling collapsed in the first room they tried to give us, the second room had used feminine pads, soiled sheets and food all over the room. We told them we would not be staying and they assured us my credit card would not be charged. Not only did they charge my card after I left, but went ahead and charged my card four times. Currently in the process of filing a fraud claim with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “With low expectations, it's a good value”
Reviews.Author: maryann617
Reviews.Content: On a whim, I stayed at this hotel for a night. No reservations... the rate was $81 including the taxes (double beds). The good: The price (see above). Parking is included. The location (it is one block from the boardwalk... it's in the heart of the action). The staff are friendly. It has a nice lobby area and chairs on the front porch. Cold mini-fridge. Linens on bed were decent. The bad: Hotel is VERY outdated. Bathroom was gross... Toilet kept running... water pressure was not-so-great... It wasn't as dirty as I anticipated, but there was still a bit of a "scary" feeling... Towels were rough and small. Bed was OLD but fit the bill, for a night. AC was super-noisy. The ugly: The ceiling looked like it could cave in at any point... Our room was near the street and the blinds were totally broken, so the street lights and sun seared my eyeballs... Overall, a good value, as long as you have low expectations. I wouldn't take kids here or have a romantic escapade, but I'd go again with a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Another perspective”
Reviews.Author: ruth345
Reviews.Content: The Admiral is an old, dowdy hotel/motel with a friendly staff and a CHEAP price, especially considering it's fantastic location. Ocean City is full of old hotels in need of updating so if you're looking for Ritzy, go to Atlantic City. OR If you can afford the finer things, stay elsewhere. If you want a friendly staff and a great location on a budget, this place is fine. It's not the Ritz, but it's not priced that way either.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: LetsGoCaps83
Reviews.Content: We originally tried to stay at another property but saw a sign a called as we drove by. They had the cheapest rate we had heard so far so we booked even though we had a room on hold down the street. The staff was very friendly down to the cleaning staff (who yelled "have a safe trip" from the balcony as we left) Our room was small and outdated. Our shower had dirty/wet washcloths in it and the toilet stopped working after one or two uses. We were promptly given another room and allowed to look at it before we switched. The room wasn't any nicer and the shower was still kind of gross but the toilet worked and we were happy enough knowing most of our time would be spent out of the room. The location was great for people/car watching since it was crusing week. It was loud and lively but we were ok with that. The hallways of the main building had an old charm about them. Would maybe return if the price was right again but the rooms definately need an update and scrubbing.

Reviews.Title: “old outdated”
Reviews.Author: kimike611
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in sep 2010 for bike week. Our room was small and not the cleanest we had ever stayed at. The worst thing was the bathroom, the sink faucet barely worked and the AC leaked. The location is pretty good, just one street back from beach, but would not stay here again. Our room was in the main building, friends stayed in the building behind ours, and there room was much nicer, in fact they stayed again in 2011. Would not stay here again, unless no other place was open. If your looking for cheap, check The Majestic, its a step up from this place.

Reviews.Title: “bed bugs bed bugs bed bugs and DIRTY! WOULD NEVER COME BACK!”
Reviews.Author: Megan92_123
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend came for senior week and when he got home he immediately started itching everywhere, we then went there again for my birthday stayed 2 days and ever since then i have non stop been itching...come to find out BED BUGS i wish i would of checked. the sheets had stains all over it, blood stains at that. we asked for new sheets and they would only bring pillow cases...MORE DIRTY ONES AT THAT! the employee then asked if he had to put them on for me. when he was putting them on he took the remote and chanced what we were watching saying he was missing his show for this...didnt take the dirty linens with him. they dont bring extra towels for you the only decent thing was the pool! the bathroom was nasty and stained the shower wasnt even big enough to shave my legs in and needed to wear my sandels in the shower. the window screen had a hole in it. when i called asking for prices of the dates i wanted the lady got an attitude and hung up on me. i really wish i didnt stay in this hotel and hoping i didnt bring the bed bugs home! please do your self a favor and DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Ants, poor plumbing, shady service.”
Reviews.Author: flea74
Reviews.Content: Unless your just looking for a bed by the boardwalk, I wouldn't stay here. There were ants, thin walls, and the bathroom was grimy at best. Stayed in the efficiency. And the third bed was tucked into a closed-in balcony with no AC. Staff was shady, I would advise people to lock valueables in their car. Parking is not guaranteed. And don't expect the staff to accomodate your complaints. Probably a perfect room for Senior Week.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't pay me to stay here”
Reviews.Author: vabeachbum91
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a friend and my two grandkids. The night we checked in we got in late due to bad weather. We were exhausted after a long drive and just wanted to relax. The room was absolutely horrific when we entered. The tiny bathroom was filthy and covered in dirt and mold. The toilet didn't work. We had to flush it by filling the wastebasket with water from the tub to pour down the toilet. The room was infested with ants. One of the kids left a juicebox on the dresser and within minutes it was covered in ants. The mattresses are horrific. Filthy with no support. They must be the mattresses originial to the hotel. Like sitting on coils. I did not specifically look for bedbugs but was not going stay in that room one night. I immediatly complained to the front desk who just looked at me like i had two heads and said they could not help me. No rooms available. We were forced to sleep in the room for the night but I quickly complained to management in the morning who apologized and gave us another room. This one was not much better. Still had ants, beds still old, checked for bedbugs and didn't see any, larger bathroom but still dirty. The maid told me that the entire hotel is infested with ants. If you are a teenager or young adult looking for a place to crash at a good rate, then by all means, stay here. If you are a family or mature adult looking for a hotel, stay clear!!! If i could award zero stars i would have. I would NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT THE BEST CHOICE AT ALL”
Reviews.Author: Kay-See-Fro-Y0
Reviews.Content: Myself and a group of my friends stayed at the admiral and had over 5 instances where the security guard (over 40 years old) made sexual, degrading, and inappropriate comments towards us (ages 17-19). The neighbors also made a complaint that the security guard was putting his arm around their 14 year old daughter asking her how old she was. Other than that the place is small, dirty, and could use some work.

Reviews.Title: “Great time, Execeptional owners!!”
Reviews.Author: unclesaway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for senior week, our 3rd trip. The room for us guys was great as well as was the hotel. The staff however were especially friendly, accomodating and just went out of their way to make sure we were all okay. I wish to thank them for all their kindness during our stay and hope to see them again for another visit very soon. Robert Kay & friends.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed ourselves”
Reviews.Author: theweekender3687
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed at the Admiral Hotel/motel in OC Maryland for the weekend...The staff we extremely pleasant, the rates were very reasonable for only being a block off the boardwalk....Althought the room was small is was just two of us so it was more then pleanty. We will most likely return to this hotel next summer but stay longer. 1 tip for future guests. get there early so you can get a parking spot(free off street parking)..lots seem to fill up quick and dont drive anywhere if you dont have too.

Reviews.Title: “Run away as fast as possible bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: benj410
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 nights last weekend. The place was dirty and the bathroom was horribly dirty. Thats not the worst part, I had bed bugs and I woke up with bites on me. I also brought them home with me. It cost me $350 to hire an exterminator, $150 for bed bug protector mattress pad and $80 for new sheets and blanket. Do yourself a favor and stay at the the best place in OC you will save money trust me. I would rather sleep in the street than here. No joke.

Reviews.Title: “It was SO bad, we laugh about it now!!”
Reviews.Author: momof2boys362
Reviews.Content: It's old and dirty!! The carpets were stained, the bathroom had old cheerios on the floor in the corners. We had a small little kitchenette. We had to scrub the counters and decided not to even take our food out of our cooler, it was just too dirty. The courtyard is actually very charming and we spent most of our time sitting out there. We had horrible neighbors who were so drunk the one guy began smashing windows to get into his room. We were literally right next to him, we called the police. His friends came back and he started attacking them. He then ran off and tried to drive away, he drove his car into the pool fence. My husband and I got absolutely NO sleep because were were in the living room area sleeping on the pull out sofa. It's definitely not a family destination!! Every room around us had people drinking and carrying on for all hours of the night. Before the window smashing began there was a party going on upstairs from us, they were hanging out on the patio had there music blasting in their room so they could hear it outside...it was 3 a.m.! Thankfully our boys slept through most of the chaos. The next morning there was broken glass ALL over the walkways. I had to carry our boys so they wouldn't trip and cut themselves. When we came back to the room late in the day, the glass was still there and our room was not cleaned at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for senior week back in 03,04 and 05”
Reviews.Author: stinamarie84
Reviews.Content: Actually I remember staying in this hotel/motel at least three time back in 03, 04 and 05 probably . I'll be honest when I say that during that time I wasn't looking for the cleanest most accommodating place to stay but rather the cheapest and closest to all the fun. This place is located about a block from all the action of the boardwalk and during the early summer months would like many others turn into a party spot for graduating students. Basically if you have the money they'll let you stay. The rooms were pretty clean during our stay and we never had a problem with reservations or check-in. The furniture in the room was a little outdated but you get what you pay for. As for noise, it was never that bad, nothing that the sweet sound of an A/C in the summertime couldn't drown out. Basically if your looking for a place to crash with friends look no further the admiral is it!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again! Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: beachfamilyfun4
Reviews.Content: my stay here was horrible my husband and I and our 2 small kids came for vacation. Were kept awake til 4am from noise and partiers and screaming so we were able to switch rooms n discovered by morning had been bitten by bed bugs and brought some home ! A terror 2 get rid of! NEVER AGAIN DO NOT STAY HERE DISGUSTING! but cheap u get what u pay for id rather pay more

Reviews.Title: “THE WORKERS ROBBED US!!”
Reviews.Author: melissa101507
Reviews.Content: MY HUSBAND WAS HAVING A GUYS NIGHT AND HIS FRIENDS BROUGH HIM BAck to his room and he passed out. Between the hours of 4-8am a worker came in his room while he waS sleeping and robbed him. went through his pockets and stole everything you can think of...(keys,ID,money,clothesect..) when i got there his stuff was everywhere, we called the cops and there worthless too. it had to be a worker b\c the door was locked and not damaged. plus it was dirty and small and smelled! NEVER GOING THERE AGAIN!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you just need a room to sleep in”
Reviews.Author: travelinteach80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Admiral for a long weekend in August of 2008. My husband (then boyfriend) and I and 2 friends were just looking for a cheap place to stay for the weekend...and we got it!! Upon check-in we switched to a room with 2 seperate sleeping areas and were given the top floor apartment type room above the office in the back. The Hilton this was not but if you need a place to sleep only then this is it. The Admiral is very outdated and it is not the cleanest hotel I have stayed in however it has a very good location (1 block from the boardwalk and ocean) and there is a pool, although very small. For as many bad reviews as it got, the place was packed for the entire weekend we were there, not just young couples/singles like us but families as well. Would this be a place that I would take my kids to...probably not but good for a quick getaway if you just need a place to sleep...let me reiterate that! Staff was very friendly and accomodated us with whatever we needed.

Reviews.Title: “I was so dissapointed in the rooms we had to get out to feel good again”
Reviews.Author: MarylandWeezie
Reviews.Content: The admiral motel was so behind the times it was like a time warp. The bathroom was very unsatisfactory in its condition and you practically had to put your feet in the shower to sit on the john. We bought our own sheets because we were concerned about the bed bugs. One of the blinds didn't work and we were on the street so everyone who walked by could see in. When we asked about it the reply from the staff was "It's not my fault". (Duh!! How about a new one!!) To watch TV and use the microwave, you couldn't plug in the coffee pot, not enough plugs. No coffee supplied either. We had to be moved to another room...first one had tons of aunts which we survived the first night with. They got into everything even my computer. Terrible motel!!!! and no compensation for all the problems. Money down the drain. Never again and nothing good to say about whole experience.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH A $1.00”
Reviews.Author: triponme
Reviews.Content: most disgusting room ever, dirty,dirty,dirty, and yes dirty..... ant infestation,dirty rugs,dirty floore, dirty fridge,and the bathroom just dreadful, u will not shower with out clothes or shoes on....parking is a joke......u will be better off sleeping in ur car!!!!!!! not worth a penny....do not even think about it

Reviews.Title: “RUN don't walk !!!!”
Reviews.Author: BEAUTYPAGEANTQUEEN
Reviews.Content: Just off the boardwalk. Talk about bait and switch. My boyfriend and I stayed over Labor Day Weekend 2008. The outside was dated but pretty much matched the surrounding hotels. At a second glance we noticed that many of the hotels, that were not part of a larger chain, were dated. (or run down) Like I said, the outside was dated but the lobby was nice. There was a tropical theme with palm trees inside. Nice front desk, seating area and coffe area. We were under the impression that we made a good choice. There are several buildings on site. We were in the main building just off the street. Granted there was a one story walk up with a wrap around porch to the lobby. That should have been a clue. We were on the third floor with no elevator. Once we made it to the first flight of steps beyond the lobby, everything changed .It was as if we were in the twlight zone. By the time we made it to the second floor with all of our bags, my boyfriend said that the hallway reminded him of "the Shinning". The carpet changed, the fixtures changed and so did the smell. It was like being in an old attic or grandma's house. Our room was a HOT MESS!!!! The room did not have peep hole like most places. There is a sign outside that stated, no guests after 11pm. (we did not see that on the way in). They also do not forward calls to the room after 11pm. That was not a problem and I will tell you why later. We had trouble with the key. When we got the room open we just stood there with our mouths open. We had a corner room with two windows. Mind you, the front window was a side by side window. One side was so dirty that we thought that it was raining. The other had broken blinds. Our room faced the street so that made chaning at night very intersting. The side window had a window unit air conditioner that appeared to be about 20 years old. All the windows had pull strings to lift and lower the blinds but no rod to vent the blinds. It was either all or nothing. The carpet was so old and dirty that we decided not to walk on it. We purchased attitional towels and the Tshirt factory and used them as mats on the floor. There were no hangers, ironing board, iron or alarm clock. The phone was mounted to the wall similar to a kitchen phone at home. We both have cell phones, Thank God!! The phone looked like it could use a good swipe with a clorox clean wipe. It was yellow. Not sure if it was purchased yellow but it was yellow now. The fire alarm was yellow and hanging from the ceiling. The sprinkler was covered with dust however, that was the least of our worries. The ceiling tiles were bent, covered with what looked to be grease and ill fitting. I asked my boyfriend to look up there for cameras. We were scared to sleep on the bed. We purchased two woven blankets for 9.99 each at the Tshirt factory to sleep on. My boyfriend laughed at me when I asked him to check under the bed for roaches or mouse traps. He did not find anything but I would not have been surprised if he did. I had a hard time closing the bathroom door, which by the way only had a knob on the inside. A vintage glass knob to be exact. There was a hook and circle to latch the door locked. It was similar to a porch latch. Good thing that we are close, we kept the door open all weekned. NICE!!! The sink was being held up with a rod similar to a broom stick. There was no stopper in the sink. I looked down expecting to find some jewerly but only found the lid to someones toothpaste. The mirror was like something from a funhouse. As I tried to do my makeup, I noticed there was a wave in the mirror. I just gave up. The outside bottom of the tub had rust. Not exactly sure how a tub can have rust on the outside, but it did. The floor was covered with vinal with a brick motif. UGLY> The toilet paper was on the back of the hopper because the bar that holds the roll was missing in action. We refused to use the towels or wash cloths because we could not tell if there were "really" clean. I am sure that they were but it was gross. The tub did not have a stopper so if you had small children you could not bathe them in the tub without some difficulty. The shower head had rust or mineral deposits on it. We purchased addtional flip flops to use as shower shoes and left them in the trash before checking out. We could not avoid taking a shower. Luckly we had anti=bacterial soap. We did avoid using the sink to brush our teeth. We used bottled water and mouth wash to rinse. There was a three drawer white dresser that appeared to be new or newer. We never unpacked. We removed the drawers and placed our bags in there. It was the cleanest thing in the room. There was a wall mounted small wicker mirror. similar to a teenage girls room, across the room that did not match a single thing in the room. It really was not easy to used because of the ackward location and lighting. Speaking of lighting. There was one overhead light. No table lamp. The bedroom light looked like a porch light. The bathroom light was just a bulb without a cover. There was a tv, that worked well and a remote. We purchased a can of Lysol at the store and sprayed everything...including the remote. The television was on top of a small fridge. We did not know what to expect on the inside the fridge. The bottom shelf on the door was missing the rail. The inside cabin had two shelves. I assume that when it was new the shelves were white plastic coated. Now the platic was peeling and had started to rust. We purchased drinks and left them in the bag. We quickly found out the the fridge worked better than the AC. Our drinks had ice crystals inside. That was not a problem. It was hot outside and our drinks were cold. The front desk said that there was a pool on the property. We decided to check it out trying to make the most out of a bad situation. Again, we stood there with our mouths open. The water did not have the sparkle that other pools had. Nor did it smell like chlorine.. I guess it was clean but it did not look refreshing. The chaise cushions were dingy and did not match. There was a coca-cola machine. that was a plus but we did not use the machine or the pool. I wanted to cry. I had envisioned a great romantic weekend and I was so turned off. My boyfriend suggested we change cloths and hit the town. I suggested getting a tetnus shot. He laughed but I knew I was being a bratty princess. He was being a good sport so I quickly changed my attitude. He did take me to the store to purchase supplies to make the place liveable. Like I mentioned, we purchased Lysol, towels, blankets, Napkins, cups and flip flops. Our bargin hotel turned into a money pit. After we checked out on Sunday we walked around to inquire about prices at other hotels. After I got home and unpacked I started to look for reviews so that we did not have the same horrible experience. We were going to go back in three weeks for the Sun Festival but today we decided not to go. We are going to plan a weekend in MD/DC Six Flags area insted. Next year we are thinking about Ocean City, NJ instead of MD. I really wish we took pictures. This place is something that you have to see to believe. On the bright side, we did have a parking pass and a short walk to the boardwalk. Pretty view of the water (from the the clean window) Monikca Delaware

Reviews.Title: “hated the admiral”
Reviews.Author: lalatina326
Reviews.Content: The Admiral had nothing to admire. We ended up buying our own sheets and needless to say we had bed bugs. Note: we stayed in the back side not the front of the Admiral.

HotelInfo.Name: The Admiral Motel
HotelInfo.Address: 806 Philadelphia Avenue, Ocean City, MD 21843
